page.title: 17Local History
page.content: 1844 Sir H.E. Bunbury had the Public House built at the North end of the village, so his men had a long way to walk to reach it, as he did not approve of them drinking and did not want to hear rowdiness. These people have told us that there were about 7 wells serving the centre of the village. Icepits Wood contains the remains of the pits used for storing ice blocks, for the use of the Hall. Mrs. Thomas was born on the night in 1917 when a Zeppelin dropped a bomb on Billericay so she was nearly called Zeppelina!
